CommentsTitle: Confusing Description but Decent Glasses for the Money
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2019
CommentsContent: So there are many possible combinations here.  I bought the "(2 Pack) Matte Black Frame Black Lens / Matte Black Frame Black Lens."  One pair is a Wayfarer clone; the other is a Clubmaster clone.But the lenses are not Black (thankfully - because if they were black they wouldn't transmit any light)  Indeed, the description shows six possible colors:  Grey, G15, Blue, Green, Red and Silver.  No Black.  And no Brown either, although some of the combinations say that the lenses are Brown.  Contradictory and very confusing!The lenses I got were more like bluish grey.  Very nice visibility.  They are plastic, just like the frames.  Despite the high ratings here, don't confuse these glasses for Maui Jim's.  The high ratings for these glasses can only be driven by the low prices.  And it is for that reason I gave them 4 stars.  They are a step up from the glasses you find in any tourist shop in a beach town, and actually for a lower price.  So that's nice.I tested out these two pair of KALIYADIs glasses, and a pair of the Polarspex Wayfarer clones I also bought here, on a drive cross country and back.Of the two pair of KALIYADIs that I got, I'm not a fan of the look or feel of the Wayfarer clone.  I like the look and feel of the Polarspex Wayfarer clones, although I like the visibility of these KALIYADIs better.However, I like the KALIYADIs Clubmaster clone a lot.  Very light and comfortable, and they look good.  An excellent value.Overall, between these KALIYADIs and the Polarspex, which are both highly rated at Amazon, I liked the KALIYADIs better.  For $16 for two pair, it's hard to go wrong.
PurchasemModel_Size: Color: B (2 Pack) Matte Black Frame Black Lens / Glossy Black Frame Black Lens

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2020
CommentsContent: I debated writing this but decided to spare someone else from this experience.I originally bought a 2 pack and loved them for the first week. These sunglasses are stylish, lightweight and have clear and crisp viewing. Then, after a week of normal use, one of the side pieces that goes behind your ear started to snap off at the hinge near the glasses part. I thought maybe I just had a defective pair and threw them away.I bought a 3 pack all of that same style, because I love how they look, and within TWO days, the exact same thing happened to one of them (as pictured). Two separate orders, two separate glasses (same style but different colors), this can't be a defect.Then four days later, the plastic part near the inside of the nose randomly breaks off a different pair (as pictured). This part connects to the plastic over the glasses which lifts up every time I try to wear them now.Three sunglasses all breaking within a week of use? No. These sunglasses are stylish but are made of cheap, brittle plastic. These are not inexpensive glasses rather they're cheap quality glasses. If you want them to just look cute for a few wears then they're worth it for just that, however, don't rely on these being around for more than a couple of weeks.

CommentsTitle: Very Nice Shades for the Price!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Needed a new pair of shades to protect my eyes from the sun while driving, but wanted to keep the cost low. I came across these on Amazon. These are very NICE shades for the price. I purchased the two pack and I LOVE them. They are better quality than you would get in the stores, not cheap plastic. NO they are not high end (duh), but they appear to be well made. They include a polarized tester allowing you to see the stark difference between no polarization versus polarization. Glad I came across these. Also, you get two microfiber cloths and two microfibers pouches to hold the glasses (if you buy the two pack). I like the pouches much better because they don't take up as much space as the cases. Lastly, they have a FREE replacement within one year if you have quality issues and a LIFETIME breakage warranty. HOW AWESOME IS THAT! You get a free repair or replacement on damaged parts. I almost put that card in the trash, glad I took the time to read it. If you are in need of a new pair of shades and don't want to break the bank - give these a try.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Here's the lo down.  I didn't know what to expect with these glasses.  They have lasted 7 months with semi regular use.  But alas, they now are broken.  Here's my take:Pros:Rediculously comfortable: seriously sometimes forgot they were on my face.Price point: pretty cheap for what you are getting.  They do feel a little cheap upon first handling but they sort of "break in" if you will.Cons:Film: as you can see in image, the film is peeling and bubbling.  This started about 3 months ago.  Maybe I needed to clean more often and store in their fabric case more often?Cheap construction:  this almost is a double edged sword.  They are light and they goes a long way for weight on your nose bridge.  But, their construction is plastic-y.  I went to remove the glasses from my head yesterday and the arm just broke at the hinging mechanism.Overall purchasing these sunglasses isn't a bad move but there's two considerations.  You will need to take special care of cleanliness and storage most likely.  Second, these are cheap but effective ... but for how long?  Participating in a purchase pattern of this sort of product obsolescence feels more like a subscription framework.If you want something to wear ever so often, go for it.  If you want something that has an ounce of staying power, spend more and get better quality.Nice while they lasted, RIP.
PurchasemModel_Size: Color: D (2 Pack) Matte Black Frame Black Lens / Matte Brown Frame Brown Lens

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2020
CommentsContent: Well, it's big and it's wide. It makes buying eyewear difficult.When I put on normal sized glasses, the stems at the sides will dig into my temples and produce lumps on the top and bottom which makes it look like I have a fat head. I mean, I do, but I don't want it to look like I do.I get tired of buying the large over-sized styles of the 80s and 90s - you know, the aviators and huge Versace type frames. Otherwise it's the large sporty wrap arounds that you should only wear when doing sports.I usually only get to pick out fun retro styles when I stumble onto a pair at a flea market or the local Chinatown. But even then, fit is usually an issue.Well when I saw these As a !lightning deal with frames measuring 144, I decided to try them out.They fit nicely without squeezing/pinching at my temples.  The stems are also long enough that I can push these things on top of my head like a headband when I'm by the pool and don't need them but wanna keep my hair from falling down into my eyes.They are not the best quality, pretty light, but at $6 a pair, they'll do.  I'm not the type of person who constantly has sunglasses on.  I tend to keep them hanging from my neck of pushed up on the top of my head (where over time the lenses will get scratched) and will put them on only when needed. So these were perfect.Also each came with a little drawstring pouch and microfiber to wipe the lens, quite handy and thoughtful.Inexpensive, large and stylish.  I would buy them again at $6 a pair.
PurchasemModel_Size: Color: D (3 Pack) Tortoise Frame G15 Lens / Glossy Black Frame Black Lens / Matte Black Frame Black Lens

CommentsTitle: One of the best deals around. Period.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2019
CommentsContent: The products are great! They are high quality and extremely comfortable. As a former employee of sunglass hut, I can honestly say that these glasses are the best replacement for Ray-Bans I‚Äôve ever owned. I‚Äôve had several pairs of the ‚Äúofficial‚Äù club masters and I have to say that for the price, there‚Äôs not one reason I wouldn‚Äôt pick these first. For a pair of polarized lenses (usually a $50+ price bump) these are BEYOND worth the money. The plastic is noticeably lighter than the $150 store brands but I believe that‚Äôs one reason I am able to wear them all day without any discomfort. The all black color option is by far my favorite and has a beautiful look to it, while the tortoise shell color has a clean matte finish that you can‚Äôt usually find in stores, only the customized pairs. The build is light but sturdy, extremely comfortable and flexible around the nose, and an even cleaner without all the branding marks all over them. 3 pairs allows me to keep one in the car, one at home and bring a pair wherever I go, while the extremely low price makes it so that I don‚Äôt have to ‚Äúbaby‚Äù my frames and can actually wear them without worry. That, or just switch up the options to pair them perfectly no matter the outfit or occasion. 100% great buy and I think I just found my new go-to frames :)To put it in short form: if you want the Ray-Ban look and quality but can‚Äôt afford $150+, getting 3 pair of these for $20 may be the best all around deal on the market.

CommentsTitle: Sturdy and does the job at a very good price.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2020
CommentsContent: Needed to replace a pair of Ray-Ban Wayfarers that got stolen out of my car.  These glasses stayed in the car and used primarily for driving.  After taking a hit for an expensive pair, I decided to see if a less expensive quality replacement was out there that I did not mind losing.A quick online vide review search lead me to these.I rwceived them yesterday and immediately noticed that they wor higher quality than your average discount  sunglasses that you would find on a rack.  The frames material felt like high quality plastic, not brittle at all. The hinges were well secured and did were not squeaky and opened smoothly.  The lenses seem like lenses and not cellophane. The big test came when I drove east into the sun the next morning.  Firstly, looking into the sun was clear with no blur from the glare that should have been there.  There was no graininess that is very apparent in cheap glasses.  The colora although darker, appeared accurate.  They were absolutely amazing.The set of glasses also came with individual bags and cleaning cloths, as well as being packaged in a sturdy box.  These are excellent glassses...well made and dies the job. I highly recommend.
